One Level Up Top Level

bootstrap/bootscanner.l - pgsql17devel-backend

  1. %top{
  2. /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3. *
  4. * bootscanner.l
  5. *      a lexical scanner for the bootstrap parser
  6. *
  7. * Portions Copyright (c) 1996-2024, PostgreSQL Global Development Group
  8. * Portions Copyright (c) 1994, Regents of the University of California
  9. *
  10. *
  11. * IDENTIFICATION
  12. *      src/backend/bootstrap/bootscanner.l
  13. *
  14. *-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  15. */
  16. #include "postgres.h"

  18. /*
  19. * NB: include bootparse.h only AFTER including bootstrap.h, because bootstrap.h
  20. * includes node definitions needed for YYSTYPE.
  21. */
  22. #include "bootstrap/bootstrap.h"
  23. #include "bootparse.h"
  24. #include "utils/guc.h"

  26. }

  28. %{

  30. /* LCOV_EXCL_START */

  32. /* Avoid exit() on fatal scanner errors (a bit ugly -- see yy_fatal_error) */
  33. #undef fprintf
  34. #define fprintf(file, fmt, msg)  fprintf_to_ereport(fmt, msg)

  36. static void
  37. fprintf_to_ereport(const char *fmt, const char *msg)
  38. {
  39.     ereport(ERROR, (errmsg_internal("%s", msg)));
  40. }


  43. static int    yyline = 1;            /* line number for error reporting */

  45. %}

  47. %option 8bit
  48. %option never-interactive
  49. %option nodefault
  50. %option noinput
  51. %option nounput
  52. %option noyywrap
  53. %option warn
  54. %option prefix="boot_yy"


  57. id        [-A-Za-z0-9_]+
  58. sid        \'([^']|\'\')*\'

  60. /*
  61. * Keyword tokens return the keyword text (as a constant string) in boot_yylval.kw,
  62. * just in case that's needed because we want to treat the keyword as an
  63. * unreserved identifier.  Note that _null_ is not treated as a keyword
  64. * for this purpose; it's the one "reserved word" in the bootstrap syntax.
  65. *
  66. * Notice that all the keywords are case-sensitive, and for historical
  67. * reasons some must be upper case.
  68. *
  69. * String tokens return a palloc'd string in boot_yylval.str.
  70. */

  72. %%

  74. open            { boot_yylval.kw = "open"; return OPEN; }

  76. close            { boot_yylval.kw = "close"; return XCLOSE; }

  78. create            { boot_yylval.kw = "create"; return XCREATE; }

  80. OID                { boot_yylval.kw = "OID"; return OBJ_ID; }
  81. bootstrap        { boot_yylval.kw = "bootstrap"; return XBOOTSTRAP; }
  82. shared_relation    { boot_yylval.kw = "shared_relation"; return XSHARED_RELATION; }
  83. rowtype_oid        { boot_yylval.kw = "rowtype_oid"; return XROWTYPE_OID; }

  85. insert            { boot_yylval.kw = "insert"; return INSERT_TUPLE; }

  87. _null_            { return NULLVAL; }

  89. ","                { return COMMA; }
  90. "="                { return EQUALS; }
  91. "("                { return LPAREN; }
  92. ")"                { return RPAREN; }

  94. [\n]            { yyline++; }
  95. [\r\t ]            ;

  97. ^\#[^\n]*        ;        /* drop everything after "#" for comments */

  99. declare            { boot_yylval.kw = "declare"; return XDECLARE; }
  100. build            { boot_yylval.kw = "build"; return XBUILD; }
  101. indices            { boot_yylval.kw = "indices"; return INDICES; }
  102. unique            { boot_yylval.kw = "unique"; return UNIQUE; }
  103. index            { boot_yylval.kw = "index"; return INDEX; }
  104. on                { boot_yylval.kw = "on"; return ON; }
  105. using            { boot_yylval.kw = "using"; return USING; }
  106. toast            { boot_yylval.kw = "toast"; return XTOAST; }
  107. FORCE            { boot_yylval.kw = "FORCE"; return XFORCE; }
  108. NOT                { boot_yylval.kw = "NOT"; return XNOT; }
  109. NULL            { boot_yylval.kw = "NULL"; return XNULL; }

  111. {id}            {
  112.                     boot_yylval.str = pstrdup(yytext);
  113.                     return ID;
  114.                 }
  115. {sid}            {
  116.                     /* strip quotes and escapes */
  117.                     boot_yylval.str = DeescapeQuotedString(yytext);
  118.                     return ID;
  119.                 }

  121. .                {
  122.                     elog(ERROR, "syntax error at line %d: unexpected character \"%s\"", yyline, yytext);
  123.                 }

  125. %%

  127. /* LCOV_EXCL_STOP */

  129. void
  130. boot_yyerror(const char *message)
  131. {
  132.     elog(ERROR, "%s at line %d", message, yyline);
  133. }

One Level Up Top Level
